bboxes.raw_text:
Carl T. Rowan, Director of the
US. Information Agency, an
nounced today that two USlA
motion pictures won top awards
in international film festivals
in October.


''Nine from Little Rock" di-
rected by Charles Cuggenheim,
received the Golden Gate Award,
first prize in its class, at the San
Francisco International Film
Festival October l4-27. The
film portrays the useful and re-
sponsible roles in American life
assumed by the nine Negro STU
dents originally integrated into
Central High School, Little Rock,
Arkansas, in 1857.


''The March" won the Miqueldo
de Orc, first prize at the In
ternational Film Festival at Bill
bao, Spain, October 2 7, as
we'll special citation from the
International Committee of Films
Education and Culture. The docu-
mentary participation of whites
in the march on Wa shington on
August %, 1868.


"The March was directed for
the US. Information Agency by
James Blue, whose earlier USlA
Films on the Alliance for Prog
ress, Letter from Colombia"
and "The School at Rincon
Santo," received top honors at
the Venice Film Festival.

When making your own draper
les, be sure to choose findings"
as safely washable as the fabric
itself. One such is a non-woven
drapery header material, strong
and stiff enough to add support
to even heavy drapery tops. This
is said to be easy to handle, form,
and sew and will retain it's
stiffness through repeated
launderings.

Phillips CINE Church. 1401 E. Adams St. will sponsor
its sixth annual and banquet, Dec. IL and 10.
banquet will Knda Hail. Central Methodist Church.
Central 1870 and the Coronation Tea will be
held Sum-, Dec. l3 at Phillips CINE Church.
seated Mrs. Ihema
Manns chairman Josephine Bruce banquet chairman Seth
Stein chairman Mrs. Blanche Christopher general
chairman


Rev. Melvin Harrison, pa stor, is standing.


Fred Banks

Mrs. Eloise McCreary wa s
honored on her birthday by mem
bers of the Medallions Club re-
Gently. Each month lucky lady
receives gifts. Photo Lab

2 USIA
Films Cited
